This is the tenth in a series of stories on the Pelican Man's Bird Sanctuary in Sarasota. An arrest warrant has been issued for Mel Beall, former Pelican Man's Bird Sanctuary clinic manager. The warrant charges Beall, 45, with obtaining a controlled substance by fraud. His present whereabouts are unknown, authorities said. Beall has been at the center of a firestorm of allegations made by former employees that he mismanaged the clinic and abused animals. In April, Beall was hospitalized under the Baker Act after he was found lying near outside the clinic with a bottle of an unknown substance nearby. The Baker Act allows authorities to hold a person for up to 72 hours if they think the individual will harm himself or others. Beall was also charged recently by the Florida Department of Business and Professional Regulation with practicing veterinary medicine without a license. Multi-agency probe
